cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 615 mi ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move west for a short time, then turn WNW and NW this weekend, crossing western Cuba and tracking toward the eastern Gulf with a likely approach to Florida’s west-central coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near or just south of Tampa Bay

weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central Florida coast from Naples through Cedar Key, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) have a 36 % cumulative chance, peaking around 29 % onset between 96–120 h; hurricane-force winds (≥64 kt) currently only 6 %.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Increasing risk of 3–5 ft or higher surge in Tampa Bay and the west-central Florida coast as the system approaches mid-next-week.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 4–8 in or more, producing flash-flood risk across the Tampa Bay watershed.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas, strong rip currents, and possible port closure or traffic restrictions during and immediately after the storm passage.
